intro: Draba balangshanica, commonly known as the Balangshan rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. This species typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Draba balangshanica is noted for its low-growing habit and is often found in high-altitude meadows.
